content.description: Match the undercling, then move to a left crimp, shoot for a far right crimp, and top out.

Sit start at the large rib feature left and uphill from

Barb Wire

. Climb up to good pockets, and reach to some small but good holds at the lip to top out. This is easy and contrivable in ways but still fun.
content.location:
Go just uphill from

Barb Wire

, and this climbs the middle of the south face of the boulder.

content.description:
Sit start on the arete just left of the sit for Wedgie.  Go straight up, eventually gaining one of the Wedgie's crimps with your right hand.  From here, make a big throw to the sloping top of the boulder.

Toping out is probably the crux.

I've heard this called V6, felt somewhat easier than that, but I could see it.
content.protection: A spotter to keep you off the boulder behind you if you blow the tricky top out.
content.location: Essentially this is on the same face as Wedgie, and just to the left of that problem. See photo.

content.description: From standing in Front of Pungusi, flip a 180 to the Wedge Boulder, sit start on 2 finger right hand slooper left hand and work up the face climb with mini crimps all the way up.
content.protection: Pads covering the root most definitely.

content.description: This is a good warm-up with great pockets. Start low, and climb straight up.

Start sitting, move right staying low til reaching the large hueco, and finish up

Northwest Arete

.
content.location:
Start low on the pinch/arete left of

The Cube Problem

.

content.description: You have to lean into the last move, and you start sideways. It is a good static climb, but it was near the edge. It has good holds but odd moves.
content.location: It is on the back side of Cube Boulder.

content.description: Press out a mantle. Use a side pull. Top out.

Start on an underclimb/sidepull guy, and ascend the face using sharp fins til you can stand on them to perform a textbook slopey topout. Step down the fins to downclimb, which is used for both the Floater and Cube Boulders.
content.location: This is on the South face of The Cube. It is the first route on the elevated platform directly catty corner from Floater.

content.description: Start on northeast arete on the cube boulder. Long reach to a pocket with the left. Then get on sloping rail and pull up to top out.
content.location: Goes from northeast arete and finishes on the east face of the Cube Boulder.

content.description:
This is a nice variation to

The Wedgie

/ The CubeProblem. SDS on the northeast aerate, trend up and right til gaining the left hand crimp for

Wedgie

, and continue the same as you would finish the

Wedgie

problem. The crux for me was holding the crossover to gain the left hand

Wedgie

crimp. I'm sure this has been done many times and combines moves from other problems, but it is super fun and more than doubles the moves for

Wedgie

.
content.protection: A pad and spotter to keep you out of the small tree.
content.location: Climb the north face of the Cube Boulder starting on some tufa sidepulls on the northeast arete.
